meanings.definition: To steal (something, especially something of small value); pilfer.
meanings.sent1: The mischievous raccoon filched some berries from the garden.
meanings.sent2: The thief filched a wallet from the unsuspecting pedestrian.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel filched nuts from the bird feeder, thinking it was a secret stash.
meanings.sent4: The pickpocket filched wallets with the skill of a magician.
meanings.sent5: The child filched candies from the jar, leaving behind a trail of wrappers.

meanings.definition: To take (something) for oneself, typically in a sneaky or dishonest way.
meanings.sent1: She filched a cookie from the jar when no one was looking.
meanings.sent2: The student filched answers from a classmate during the exam.
meanings.sent3: The cat filched a fish from the kitchen counter, thinking it was a clever move.
meanings.sent4: The con artist filched money from unsuspecting victims with smooth talk.
meanings.sent5: The fox filched eggs from the henhouse under the cover of darkness.
